page.title: 03 Meall Bhanabhie: Flora 1
page.content: {Tree Cover} While a large part of the hillside is covered with coniferous forest, there are a variety of other habitats. Small areas of deciduous trees and areas of Scots Pine, part of the original, native, woodland cover exist in and around the gardens of the low lying ground. Among the other trees to be found on the south facing slopes are oak, holly, hazel and alder; while Scots Pine and birch favour the north facing slopes of Glen Laragain, to the north of the survey area. The hazel and holly are often found as a thick under-brush while birch is quick to colonize any open spaces. The highest tree on the hillside is usually rowan.
